item.description: Update Full River Rescue; INC#0991; 04:03PM; 650 La River; MAP: https://bit.ly/3uzy6iO; Sepulveda Basin; The dog has been safely secured by firefighters and will be brought up to the surface. The bystander who went in the water earlier and required rescue was transported to the hospital with dog bite wounds. The female patient, first rescue, did not require transport. No further details.; FS 88; Batt 10; Valley Bureau; Council District 6; BC10 BC14 CM40 CM42 E100 E239 E260 E278 E288 E39 E88 EM10 H1 H3 HA1 HA3 HR3 PI1 RA100 RA83 RA839 RA860 RA90 SC1 SW44 SW88 T39 T60 T88 UR88; CH5; 17 18; Margaret Stewart

Full River Rescue; INC#0991; 03:37PM; 650 La River; MAP: https://bit.ly/3uzy6iO; Sepulveda Basin; LAFD is continuing the rescue efforts for the dog from both the ground and the air. PLEASE do NOT enter the water to attempt to get the dog. Bystanders doing so put themselves at risk and create yet another human rescue. ; FS 88; Batt 10; Valley Bureau; Council District 6; BC10 BC14 CM40 CM42 E100 E239 E260 E278 E288 E39 E88 EM10 H1 H3 HA1 HA3 HR3 RA100 RA83 RA839 RA860 RA90 SC1 SW44 SW88 T39 T60 T88 UR88; CH5; 17 18; Margaret Stewart

Full River Rescue; INC#0991; 03:11PM; 650 La River; MAP: https://bit.ly/3uzy6iO; Sepulveda Basin; LAFD Air Ops tracked the dog and made multiple rescue attempts. The dog was able to run downstream away from the rescuer and continued to fight. Ground resources redeployed down river as the helicopter tracked the dog for a more effective rescue opportunity. Unfortunately, during this time a bystander entered the water. He was able to grab the dog and they then were swept downstream. He was able to grab hold of a rope sent over the side from other bystanders / LAPD (exact source of the rope is unknown at this time). LAFD resources are now working to conduct another rescue of both the person and dog.; FS 88; Batt 10; Valley Bureau; Council District 6; BC10 BC14 CM40 CM42 E100 E239 E260 E278 E288 E39 E88 EM10 H1 H3 HA1 HA3 HR3 RA83 RA839 RA860 RA90 SC1 SW44 SW88 T39 T60 T88 UR88; CH5; 17 18; Margaret Stewart

Full River Rescue; INC#0991; 02:40PM; 650 La River; MAP: https://bit.ly/3uzy6iO; Sepulveda Basin; A rope system was used to lower one firefighter over the edge and they were able to get a rescue ring to the patient. She abandoned the life ring in efforts to keep hold of her dog. LAFD Air Ops lowered a rescuer from the helicopter and secured the patient and the tracked the dog downriver approximately another 200'. Once the dog was located, a rescuer was lowered and they captured the dog. Unfortunately, the scared animal fought the rescuer and broke loose. Air Ops has continued to the next location downriver to again effect a rescue. ; FS 88; Batt 10; Valley Bureau; Council District 6; BC10 BC14 CM40 CM42 E100 E239 E260 E278 E288 E39 E88 EM10 H1 H3 HA1 HA3 HR3 RA83 RA839 RA90 SC1 SW44 SW88 T39 T60 T88 UR88; CH5; 17 18; Margaret Stewart

Full River Rescue; INC#0991; 02:13PM; 650 La River; MAP: https://bit.ly/3uzy6iO; Sepulveda Basin; Firefighters have made visual contact of one female patient with dog in the river. The last sighting was at Kester. Firefighters are deploying to multiple predesignated rescue points along the river to conduct rescue operations. The water is estimated to be moving 5-10mph. The patient is working to fight the current and hold location at this time.; FS 88; Batt 10; Valley Bureau; Council District 6; BC10 BC14 CM40 CM42 E100 E239 E288 E39 E88 EM10 H1 H3 HA1 HA3 HR3 RA83 RA839 RA90 SC1 SW44 SW88 T39 T88 UR88; CH5; 17 18; Margaret Stewart

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0806; 12:28PM; 630 S Wilton Pl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3LlEv7P; Koreatown; KNOCKDOWN: 31 firefighters extinguished the fire in 14 minutes with no injuries reported. Situational update: a contents-only fire was located on the 1st floor. No further details.; FS 29; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 10; BC11 BC5 E13 E226 E229 E261 E29 RA61 RA829 T26 T29 T61; CH9; 15; Margaret Stewart

Structure Fire; INC#0806; 12:14PM; 630 S Wilton Pl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3LlEv7P; Koreatown; Two story, (vacant) craftsman style home with fire on the 2nd floor. Firefighters are in the offensive mode.; FS 29; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 10; BC11 BC5 E13 E226 E229 E261 E29 RA61 RA829 T26 T29 T61; CH9; 15; Margaret Stewart

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1476; 09:24PM; 122 S Coronado St; MAP: https://bit.ly/35fErHm; Westlake; KNOCKDOWN: 31 firefighters extinguished the fire in 18 minutes with no injuries reported. The cause and $ loss are TBD. No further details.; FS 20; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 13; BC11 E11 E20 E211 E220 E3 RA11 RA20 T11 T20; CH9; 13; Margaret Stewart

Structure Fire; INC#1476; 09:06PM; 122 S Coronado St; MAP: https://bit.ly/35fErHm; Westlake; Two story, vacant balloon-style construction single family dwelling well involved in fire with an exposed building on one side. Firefighters are deploying the wagon battery to quickly get a large stream of water on the fire while also investigating the exposed building for extension.; FS 20; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 13; BC11 E11 E20 E211 E220 E3 RA11 RA20 T11 T20; CH9; 13; Margaret Stewart

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1222; 06:20PM; 19123 W Friar St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3ILcfdl; Tarzana; KNOCKDOWN: 31 firefighters extinguished the fire in 19 minutes with no injuries reported. The fire was contained to the converted garage. Cause and $ loss TBD. No further details.; FS 93; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District 3; BC17 E273 E293 E305 E72 E73 RA72 RA84 T105 T73 T93; CH9; 17; Margaret Stewart
